install.name: Captify Content
install.author: Joomla Bamboo
install.copyright: Copyright (C) 2009 Joomla Bamboo. All rights reserved.
install.description: Captify Content displays the image assigned to your category or section and the title using the awesome captifyScript. If the section or category does not have an image assigned to it then it will not show. To assign an image to the section or category go to the section or category manager open the section/category and select an image from the drop down list. Please note the image must be located in the images/stories folder of joomla which is the default folder for the section and category images to be stored anyway. Please note that you need to have the JB Library plugin installed and published for this module to work as desired.

param.name: type
param.label: Content source
param.description: Select whether to display sections, categories, k2 or Joomla content items.

param.name: countcc
param.label: Item Count
param.description: The number of items to display (default is 5)

param.name: imagesPerRow
param.label: Items Per Row
param.description: Set the number of images to be per row.

param.name: titleBelow
param.label: Display title below image
param.description: Display the title below the image

param.default: The following options determine how the css and javascript/jquery files are referenced on your site. The option to load the scripts in the head of the template is ideal but will not work if Joomla cache is turned on. The option to load them in the website body is easy but is not xhtml compliant. The last option disables the scripts all together and is ideal if you are using more than one instance of the module on the page. If you select the last option then you need to make sure that the scripts are included at least once on the page in your template or via another module.

param.name: loadCSS
param.label: Load CSS?
param.description: Set this option to yes if you would like the module to load its css styles. Set this option to no if you would like disable the modules css syles.
param.option: Yes - Loads in the head but incompatible with Joomla cache.
Yes - Load in the body but not xhtml valid

param.name: loadJS
param.label: Load Scripts?
param.description: Set this option to yes if you would like the module to load its javascript files. Set this option to no if you would like disable the modules javascript files.
param.option: Yes - Loads in the head but incompatible with Joomla cache.
Yes - Load in the body but not xhtml valid

param.name: secOrdering
param.label: Ordering of Sections
param.description: Select the order in which the section items to appear.

param.name: catid
param.label: Category
param.description: Select the categories that you would like to display

param.name: artid
param.label: Articles
param.description: Select the articles you would like to display.

param.name: ordering
param.label: Ordering of content
param.description: Select the order in which the content items should appear.

param.name: show_front
param.label: Show Front page Items
param.description: Display items in the module that also are displayed on the front page.

param.name: k2catid
param.label: Filter items by category
param.description: Select one ore more categories for which you want to filter an items list. Select none to fetch items from all categories.

param.name: itemid
param.label: K2 Items
param.description: Select the K2 items you would like to display.

param.name: orderingK2
param.label: Ordering
param.description: Ordering options

param.name: displayImages
param.label: K2 Image source
param.description: Choose to use the K2 item image or the first image in the K2 content.

param.name: image_width
param.label: Width of the resized image
param.description: Set the width of the resized image.

param.name: image_height
param.label: Height of the resized image
param.description: Set the width of the resized image.

param.name: option
param.label: Resize Method
param.description: The method you would like to use when resizing images.

param.name: imageDimensions
param.label: Output image height and width?
param.description: This option when enabled prints the height and width of the images as a style declaration. This option is beneficial for site loading and seo but may have adverse results if the crop width and height ratios do not match the image width and image heights of the original image

param.name: rightMargin
param.label: Thumbnail right margin
param.description: Enter a px unit for the right margin of the images. Applied if equalising margins are disabled.

param.name: bottomMargin
param.label: Thumbnail bottom margin
param.description: Enter a px unit for the bottom margin of the images.

param.name: useCaptify
param.label: Enable the hover effect?
param.description: Set this option to yes if you want to display the transition effect when hovering over the item. By setting this option to no you can use the captify module as an image menu that directs the user to the content, categories or sections when clicked.

param.name: background
param.label: Background Theme
param.description: Enable image fade effects on page load and mouse hover

param.name: transition
param.label: Overlay Transition Type
param.description: Select the type of transition used to display the overlay title when the image is moused over.

param.name: position
param.label: Overlay Position
param.description: Original positioning of the overlay effect

param.name: speed
param.label: Transition Speed In
param.description: The speed that the captify transition should occur in ms.

param.name: speedOut
param.label: Transition Speed Out
param.description: The speed that the captify transition should occur in ms after the mouse leaves the image.

param.name: fadeEffect
param.label: Image Fade on Hover
param.description: Enable image fade effects on page load and mouse hover

param.name: cache
param.label: Caching
param.description: Select whether to cache the content of this module

param.name: cache_time
param.label: Cache Time
param.description: The time before the module is recached
